title: Fans divided by Vinnie Jones' X Factor: Celebrity performance
text:
Vinnie Jones brought the house down with his performance Picture: Rex)

Vinnie Jones made his X Factor: Celebrity debut with a very spirited performance of The Blues Brothers’ Everybody Needs Somebody.

The former footballer brought the house down and got a standing ovation from the judges.

Performing in memory of his late wife Tanya, Vinnie took to the stage full of manic energy and was joined on the stage by a growing band of dancers.

At the end of his slot, everybody was on their feet including Simon Cowell, Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh.

‘I would say after that,’ Simon told the X Men actor. ‘There is a shot you could win this competition.’

Vinnie was a true showman, even if he did spend most of the time shouting (Picture: Rex)

Viewers certainly had a lot of thoughts.

It seems Vinnie is the musical equivalent of Marmite – some loved it, some hated it!

#XFactorCelebrity

Let's go #vinniejones

Best performance of the night by far — Craig Coates (@geordie39) October 26, 2019

Ah.. vinnie jones is a legend. #CelebrityXFactor — ED JAMES (@edjames_) October 26, 2019

‘Vinnie Jones is a legend,’ wrote one fan and do you know what?

We can’t help but agree.

And Vinnie Jones wasn’t just karaoke? It was shouty and pretty awful. #XFactorCelebrity — Possibleprince7 (@Possibleprince7) October 26, 2019

@TheXFactor I just turned the box on to Vinnie Jones screaming! What the hell is this load of junk ?? Retired folk should remain retired!!! — Neil (@dexterbeefy) October 26, 2019

Vinnie Jones just shouted the whole way through that absolutely awful #XFactorCelebrity — Gavin Yid (@Gavlarcoys) October 26, 2019

One fan did point out that ‘Vinnie Jones just shouted the whole way through that,’ but at least he had fun doing it?

The judges were certainly full of praise for him, with Nicole commenting that: ‘I have so much respect for you being here tonight thank you for putting all of your energy into that performance that was amazing.’

‘Movie star, football legend,’ Louis Walsh said.

‘Now you’re a pop star!’

Could we be looking at our winner? (Picture: Rex)

We wouldn’t compare him to Ariana Grande, Louis, but it’s a start!

The first live show of The X Factor: Celebrity also saw the return of The Chase’s Jenny Ryan, who was sent straight to the first safe chair, after she was unceremoniously booted from the programme last week.
